meanings.definition: A child of one's uncle or aunt.
meanings.sent1: My cousin and I played together at the park.
meanings.sent2: I have many cousins because my mom has a lot of siblings.
meanings.sent3: My cousin always beats me at video games, but I still love playing with them.
meanings.sent4: The bond between cousins is like having a built-in best friend.
meanings.sent5: Every summer, my cousin and I go on exciting adventures together.

meanings.definition: A relative descended from a common ancestor.
meanings.sent1: My cousin and I share the same great-grandparents.
meanings.sent2: Family reunions are always fun with so many cousins around.
meanings.sent3: My cousin's love for spicy food must be genetic!
meanings.sent4: The family tree branches out with each new cousin born.
meanings.sent5: Cousins can feel like siblings from another lifetime.

meanings.definition: A person or thing related or analogous to another.
meanings.sent1: That car model is considered the cousin of the one I own.
meanings.sent2: The new smartphone is like a cousin to the previous model.
meanings.sent3: The dessert was a sweet cousin to the main course.
meanings.sent4: The two paintings were like distant cousins in the art gallery.
meanings.sent5: The novel's sequel felt like a close cousin to the original story.
